topic.name: English Grammar - Tenses Mastery Test
topic.description: Challenging questions covering all English tenses to master advanced grammar

questions.question_text: Which sentence correctly uses the Past Perfect Continuous tense?

options.text: She had been working here since 2010 before she moved.
She worked here since 2010 before she moved.
She was working here before she moved.
She has worked here before she moved.

questions.question_text: Identify the sentence that uses the Future Perfect tense correctly:

options.text: By next year, I will have finished my studies.
I will finish my studies by next year.
I will be finishing my studies by next year.
I will have been finishing my studies by next year.

questions.question_text: Which sentence correctly illustrates the use of Present Perfect Continuous?

options.text: I have been reading this book for three hours.
I have read this book for three hours.
I read this book for three hours.
I am reading this book for three hours.

questions.question_text: Choose the sentence with correct use of the Past Simple passive voice:

options.text: The letter was sent yesterday by John.
The letter sent yesterday by John.
The letter has been sent yesterday by John.
The letter is sent yesterday by John.

questions.question_text: Which sentence uses the Future Continuous tense correctly?

options.text: This time tomorrow, I will be flying to Paris.
This time tomorrow, I will fly to Paris.
This time tomorrow, I will have flown to Paris.
This time tomorrow, I will have been flying to Paris.

questions.question_text: Identify the sentence correctly using the Present Simple tense for scheduled future events:

options.text: The train leaves at 8 PM tonight.
The train is leaving at 8 PM tonight.
The train will leave at 8 PM tonight.
The train has left at 8 PM tonight.

questions.question_text: Which sentence correctly uses the Past Perfect tense?

options.text: They had left before we arrived.
They left before we had arrived.
They left before we arrived.
They have left before we arrived.

questions.question_text: Select the sentence that correctly uses the Present Perfect Passive voice:

options.text: The report has been completed by the team.
The report has completed by the team.
The report has been completing by the team.
The report is completed by the team.

questions.question_text: Which sentence uses the Past Continuous tense correctly?

options.text: I was watching TV when she called.
I watched TV when she called.
I have been watching TV when she called.
I had watched TV when she called.

questions.question_text: Which sentence demonstrates correct use of the Future Perfect Continuous tense?

options.text: By next month, she will have been working here for five years.
By next month, she will be working here for five years.
By next month, she will have worked here for five years.
By next month, she will be worked here for five years.

questions.question_text: Identify the correct question form in the Present Perfect tense:

options.text: Have you ever visited London?
Did you ever visit London?
Do you ever visit London?
Are you ever visiting London?

questions.question_text: Choose the sentence with the correct use of Present Simple Passive:

options.text: The house is cleaned every day.
The house cleans every day.
The house cleaning every day.
The house was cleaned every day.

questions.question_text: Which sentence is correctly using Past Perfect Continuous passive voice?

options.text: The work had been being done for hours when they arrived.
The work had been done for hours when they arrived.
The work was being done for hours when they arrived.
The work has been done for hours when they arrived.

questions.question_text: Select the sentence correctly using Future Simple Passive:

options.text: The project will be completed by next week.
The project will complete by next week.
The project will be completing by next week.
The project will have completed by next week.

questions.question_text: Identify the sentence that correctly uses mixed tenses:

options.text: If I had studied harder, I would be passing the exam now.
If I studied harder, I will pass the exam now.
If I had studied harder, I would be passing the exam now.
If I studied harder, I would have passed the exam.

questions.question_text: Which sentence correctly uses the Present Perfect Continuous to express duration?

options.text: He has been playing football for two hours.
He is playing football for two hours.
He was playing football for two hours.
He played football for two hours.

questions.question_text: Choose the correct use of Past Simple with time expressions:

options.text: I saw her yesterday.
I have seen her yesterday.
I had seen her yesterday.
I see her yesterday.

questions.question_text: Which sentence correctly uses the Future with 'going to' for plans?

options.text: I am going to visit my parents next weekend.
I go to visit my parents next weekend.
I will going to visit my parents next weekend.
I will visit to my parents next weekend.

questions.question_text: Identify the sentence that correctly uses Present Continuous to express future arrangements:

options.text: We are meeting them tomorrow.
We meet them tomorrow.
We will meet them tomorrow.
We met them tomorrow.

questions.question_text: Which sentence uses Present Perfect to express life experience?

options.text: I have been to Japan twice.
I have gone to Japan twice.
I went to Japan twice.
I am going to Japan twice.

questions.question_text: Choose the sentence that correctly uses Past Perfect with a clear time reference:

options.text: She had left by the time I arrived.
She left by the time I arrived.
She has left by the time I arrived.
She leaves by the time I arrived.

questions.question_text: Which sentence shows correct use of Present Simple for habits?

options.text: He goes to the gym every day.
He is going to the gym every day.
He went to the gym every day.
He has gone to the gym every day.

questions.question_text: Identify the sentence that uses Future Continuous for polite enquiries:

options.text: Will you be joining us for dinner?
Are you joining us for dinner?
Will you join us for dinner?
Do you join us for dinner?

questions.question_text: Which sentence correctly uses Past Continuous for two simultaneous actions?

options.text: I was cooking while he was cleaning.
I cooked while he cleaned.
I had cooked while he cleaned.
I will be cooking while he cleans.

questions.question_text: Choose the sentence correctly using Present Perfect for recent actions with 'just':

options.text: She has just left the office.
She just left the office.
She had just left the office.
She is just leaving the office.

questions.question_text: Identify the correct use of Past Perfect Continuous to express duration:

options.text: He had been waiting for two hours before the train arrived.
He waited for two hours before the train arrived.
He has been waiting for two hours before the train arrived.
He was waiting for two hours before the train arrived.

questions.question_text: Which sentence correctly uses Future Perfect Passive to indicate completion?

options.text: The documents will have been signed by tomorrow.
The documents will be signed by tomorrow.
The documents will have signed by tomorrow.
The documents will be signing by tomorrow.

questions.question_text: Choose the sentence with correct use of Present Simple for facts:

options.text: Water boils at 100 degrees Celsius.
Water is boiling at 100 degrees Celsius.
Water boiled at 100 degrees Celsius.
Water will boil at 100 degrees Celsius.

questions.question_text: Identify the sentence that correctly uses the passive form in Past Continuous:

options.text: The house was being painted all day.
The house was painted all day.
The house is being painted all day.
The house has been painted all day.
